      • getScore

        public long getScore(int nx,
                     int no,
                     int ns)
        Parameters:
        nx - number of xs
        no - number of os
        ns - number of spaces
        Returns:
        score corresponding to the board configuration
        Score is computed as 10^nx when there are only os and spaces. Similarly, Score is computed as -10^no when there are only xs and spaces. Score is Integer max value when x win and Integer min value when o win. Score is 0 for other cases

      • getScoreRowWise

        public long getScoreRowWise()
        Returns:
        returns score corresponding to row wise computation
        Computes score for 1D array scanned rowwise by keeping track of number of xs,os and spaces in each row and invoking getScore

      • getScoreColWise

        public long getScoreColWise()
        Returns:
        returns score corresponding to column wise computation
        Computes score for 1D array scanned column wise by keeping track of number of xs,os and spaces in each column and invoking getScore

      • getScoreDiagonal

        public long getScoreDiagonal()
        Returns:
        returns score corresponding to primary diagonal
        Computes score for 1D array scanned along primary diagonal and then invoking getScore

      • getScoreSecondaryDiagonal

        public long getScoreSecondaryDiagonal()
        Returns:
        returns score corresponding to secondary diagonal
        Computes score for 1D array scanned along secondary diagonal and then invoking getScore

      • checkForWin

        public boolean checkForWin()
        Returns:
        true when the state is a win else false
        Computes the score of the board configuration along row, column wise and through primary and secondary diagonals. When the score is grater than 10^board length, then the state is considered as win state. This method also updates the winner of the game.
